members.name: TextDecoder()
members.description: Returns a newly constructed TextDecoder that will generate a code point stream with the decoding method specified in parameters.

parameters.name: utfLabel Optional
parameters.description: Is a DOMString, defaulting to "utf-8", containing the label of the encoder. Each label is associated with a specific encoding type: Possible values of utfLabel Encoding "unicode-1-1-utf-8", "utf-8", "utf8" 'utf-8' "866", "cp866", "csibm866", "ibm866" 'ibm866' "csisolatin2", "iso-8859-2", "iso-ir-101", "iso8859-2", "iso88592", "iso_8859-2", "iso_8859-2:1987", "l2", "latin2" 'iso-8859-2' "csisolatin3", "iso-8859-3", "iso-ir-109", "iso8859-3", "iso88593", "iso_8859-3", parameters.name: options Optional
parameters.description: Is a TextDecoderOptions dictionary with the property:

parameters.name: fatal
parameters.description: A Boolean flag indicating if the TextDecoder.decode() method must throw a DOMException with the "EncodingError" value when an coding error is found. It defaults to false.

members.name: TextDecoder.encoding
members.description: Is a DOMString containing the name of the decoder, that is a string describing the method the TextDecoder will use.

members.name: TextDecoder.fatal
members.description: Is a Boolean indicating whether the error mode is fatal.

members.name: TextDecoder.ignoreBOM
members.description: Is a Boolean indicating whether the byte order marker is ignored.

members.name: TextDecoder.decode()
members.description: Returns a DOMString containing the text decoded with the method of the specific TextDecoder object.

parameters.name: buffer Optional
parameters.description: Is either an ArrayBuffer or an ArrayBufferView containing the text to decode.

parameters.name: options Optional
parameters.description: Is a TextDecodeOptions dictionary with the property:

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: A Boolean flag indicating that additional data will follow in subsequent calls to decode(). Set to true if processing the data in chunks, and false for the final chunk or if the data is not chunked. It defaults to false.
